Class KnapSack

  • java.lang.Object
    • KnapSack

  • public class KnapSack
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains methods to test Knapsack problem
    Author:
    Sean Gibbons

    • Method Detail

      • knapsackSumA

        public static int knapsackSumA(int[] w,
                               int n,
                               int limit)
        A method which fits the maximum number of items inside a "knapsack" of a given capacity based on weight
        Parameters:
        w - contains n positive integers (n <= w.length).
        n - the current stage
        limit - the remaining capacity of the knapsack
        Returns:
        the sum of some of these integers such that it has the largest possible value without exceeding limit.

      • knapsackSumB

        public static int knapsackSumB(int[] w,
                               int n,
                               int limit,
                               java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> list)
        A method which fits the maximum number of items inside a "knapsack" of a given capacity based on weight and also tracks the items in a list
        Parameters:
        w - contains n positive integers (n <= w.length).
        n - the current stage
        limit - the remaining capacity of the knapsack
        list - the items in the knapsack
        Returns:
        the sum of some of these integers such that it has the largest possible value without exceeding limit.

      • createFiles

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> createFiles(java.util.Scanner in)
        Creates and returns a String of file names from a given Scanner source
        Parameters:
        in - the Scanner source file
        Returns:
        a list of file names

      • processFiles

        public static void processFiles(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> files,
                                java.io.PrintWriter output)
        Processes a list of filenames and uses the Knapsack method on them. After doing so, writes the output to a PrintWriter
        Parameters:
        files - A list of files to test Knapsack with
        output - the output file where the results are written to

      • performKnapSack

        public static java.lang.String performKnapSack(int limit,
                                               int[] weights)
        Performs the knapsack problem on a given set of weights and a limit and returns the result as a String
        Parameters:
        limit - the max capacity of the knapsack container
        weights - an array of weights with which the optimal configuration is found
        Returns:
        the results as a String

      • fileToScanner

        public static java.util.Scanner fileToScanner(java.lang.String fName)
        Converts the given file to Scanner
        Parameters:
        fName - The String name of a file
        Returns:
        A Scanner of the file with the given file name

      • outputFile

        public static java.io.PrintWriter outputFile(java.lang.String fName)
        Creates a file of the given name
        Parameters:
        fName - The name of the file to be created
        Returns:
        A PrintWriter of the same name as fName which can be manipulated and then saved
